								<h3 align="left"><font face="Tahoma">
								<a name="md5"></a>MD5 Format</font></h3>
									<p align="left">
									<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">MD5 is a proprietary but 
									open format specific to Doom 3 and allows 
									models to be animated by the use of an 
									internal skeleton. Generally two files are 
									needed to make a functional MD5 model; 
									md5mesh and md5anim. The 3rd, md5camera, 
									allows the creation and use of complex 
									camera paths used during cut scenes&nbsp; 
									Read more at
									<a href="http://www.modwiki.net/wiki/MD5_(file_format)#Tools">Modwiki.</a>&nbsp; A list of useful tools 
									for export and import of the various MD5 
									file formats follows. </font></p>

					</div><h4>
			<font face="Tahoma"><a name="MD3">MD3</a> Format - Quake 3</font></h4>
		<p>
			The </p>
					<h5><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">Tools</font></h5>
					<ul>
						<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.swissquake.ch/chumbalum-soft/">MilkShape 3D</a>: animator, modeler, game format 
						converter, does MD3 natively. No longer freeware, now 
						triialware. Cost: $35</font></li>
						<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a href="http://www.misfitcode.com/misfitmodel3d/download.html">Misfit Model 3D 
						</a>: A triangle loving open source 
						modeller and animator that does MD3 out of the box, 
						handles animation well.</font></li>
		</ul>
					<h5><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">Exporting Tutorials</font></h5>
					<ul>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/wrath/tutorials/Quake3/Quake3-format.html">
						Quake3 Player Model Format</a>: Wrath’s page on the 
						general Q3A model setup should probably be the starting 
						place for most beginners wanting to export a Q3A 
						character model. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.4thdimented.com/dimented_tutorialQuake3_1.htm">
						Getting a Model into Quake 3</a>: Steve Bender has done 
						an outstanding tutorial that walks the modeler through 
						putting a character model into the Quake 3 game.</font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/gauss/test/headmodeltut.html">
						Heads! Heads! Heads!</a>: Making and exporting character 
						heads for Team Arena. Not a modeling tutorial.</font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://home.earthlink.net/~timhunter/digital/tutorials/tut_01.html">
						Adding Custom Head Models to Q3TA</a>: Tim hunter does a 
						short tutorial on the export and pakking process. </font> 
						</li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">

						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.pharfruminsain.com/quake/pakmover.asp">
						Pakmover</a>: A Pak file managing utility. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://users.chello.be/sf15772/q3ase.html">
						Q3ASE</a>: The Q3A shader&nbsp; or. For making SFX 
						happen on your skins. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.machinima.com/articles/modelling_intro_3/index.shtml">Intoduction to modeling using Milkshape 3D part 3: 
						Animation</a>: Ben Moss teaches animating in Milkshape 
						3D. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.bpeers.com/software/texsynth/">Texsynth</a>: From Bert Peers, the guy who gave you 
						Q3ASE, a utility that manipulates any texture into a 
						tiling texture. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.colorschemer.com/online/">Color Schemer</a>: An on-line (or downloadable) 
						color-coordinating tool. Enter the RGB values of a color 
						and it suggests coordinating colors. </font></li>
					</ul>
					<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt; font-weight:700">Skin Making Tutorials</font><ul>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/kingscastle/tute_1.htm">
						Skin Your Knees</a>: An outstanding and extremely 
						thorough approach to painting a character model skin by 
						Dave King</font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/baneforge/tutorials/q3ateam101.htm">
						Team Skins ... making the files work</a>: Chemical Burn 
						explains how to make team skin files work in Q3A v1.29h 
						and up. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/qbranch/tutorials/shaders-1.shtml">

						scripts that are the core of Q3A's special effects 
						department. </font></li>

						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/baneforge/tutorials/">
						baneforge</a>: Chemical Burn has tutes on Pakfile 
						making, skin making, and creating an alpha channel. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/qbranch/home.shtml">
						Harelequin's qbranch</a>: Harlequin shows how to set up 
						a skin layout, create several texture effects, has one 
						of the best shader tutorials, </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.gameart.com/">
						gameart</a> 
						</font> 
						</li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/skintutor/frames.html">
						skintutor</a>: Slaine focuses primarily on Q1 and Q2 
						model skin painting. Still, some good painting 
						techniques here. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://showcase.netins.net/web/wolf359/">
						PC Resources for Photoshop</a>: interesting photoshop 
						tutorials and a lot of links. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/bladekiller/hairtut.htm">
						Painting Hair</a>: Bladekiller shows how she does hair. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.geocities.com/kingofdaveness/tut_stepbystep.html">
						Painting Armor</a>: The king of Daveness shows how he 
						paints body armor. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.geocities.com/kingofdaveness/work_AIE_hibug.html">
						Bug Limb Tutorial</a>: Dave King shows some texture 
						unwrap techniques and goes into material creation</font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.quakefiles.com/rorshach/skinworld/shelpq3c.htm">
						Skinning Visor</a>: Rorshach discusses how to best work 
						with the Visor model and mesh (from the original 
						Q3Test). </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fileplanet.com/dl/dl.asp?polycount/cottages/darkhorizon/DHcacodemon_tut_01.avi">
						Dark_Horizon video tutorial #1</a>, 
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fileplanet.com/dl/dl.asp?polycount/cottages/darkhorizon/DHcacodemon_tut_02.avi">tutorial #2</a>, 
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fileplanet.com/dl/dl.asp?polycount/cottages/darkhorizon/DHcacodemon_tut_03.avi">tutorial #3</a>, 
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fileplanet.com/dl/dl.asp?polycount/cottages/darkhorizon/DHcacodemon_tut_04.avi">tutorial #4</a>, 
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fileplanet.com/dl/dl.asp?polycount/cottages/darkhorizon/DHcacodemon_tut_05.avi">tutorial #5</a> : These five downloadable .avi 
						files&nbsp; not streaming video&quot; 
						working on the face of his cacodemon skin.  
						</font> 
						</li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/redlemons/">
						Redlemons’ Paint Shop Pro tutorials</a>: nifty 
						collection of how-to’s for painting Q3A appropriate game 
						content using Paint Shop Pro v6. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.cybermodels.co.uk/html/Digital_painting.htm">
						Digital Painting</a>: Darrel Pattenden shows how to 
						creating an organized arrangement of layers for painting 
						skin 
						</font> 
						</li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.coronaleonis.com/tutorial/index.html">
						Skin Prep &amp; Mapping</a>: HyPer covers a bunch of related 
						topics on skin set up and skin mapping. </font></li>
						<li type="disc">
						<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
						<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/souldesigns/skinning.html">
						Painting skin tones</a>: Soul shows how he sets up a 
						swatch paletted for painting a caucasian skin. </font></li>
					</ul>
					<font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt; font-weight:700">Audio/Voice/Sound Resources</font><ul>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/voxfeminae/">VoxFeminae:</a> Caryn &quot;Hellchick&quot; Law's site on making 
						voices and sounds for games ... several tutorials on 
						various subjects. <br>&nbsp;</font></li>
</ul>

<h3>
					<font face="Tahoma"><a name="Useful_Links_">Useful Links </a>&amp; Reference Resources</font></h3>
<ul>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://oboylephoto.com/ruins/index.htm">Modern Ruins</a>: Utterly fantastic black and white photo 
					essays of ruins from the modern era. Mostly abandoned 
					places.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.abandoned-places.com/">Abandoned Places</a>: An equally stunning site with more 
					photos of urban abandonment.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.3dtotal.com/ffa/textures/texture1a.asp">3dTotal Free Texture Library</a>: Nice selection of small 
					color (photo) and bump maps.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.gamedev.net/community/forums/topic.asp?topic_id=202348">GameDev.Net forum thread on modeling tools</a>: Link to 
					forum listing of 2D and 3D software at GameDev.net. Ranked 
					by price!!</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fineart.sk/">Fineart.sk</a>: 
					Phenomenal Photo reference page for the human body and many 
					head photos. Subscription required for full benefit.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.calacademy.org/exhibits/skulls/">Skull Exhibit</a>: Several pages of images of creature 
					skulls. You can find hi-res photographs of nearly every 
					skull imaginable. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.slawcio.com/">Ultimate 
					Guide to Science Fiction &amp; Fantasy Art</a>: Over 1100 
					artists and galleries … pro, fan &amp; pro wannabe. </font>
	</li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://dynamic.gamespy.com/~polycount/ubb/Forum1/HTML/010080.html?00000">Reference Image Thread</a>: Bearkub's ongoing polycount 
					reference image thread. Many good reference sources. </font>
	</li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/skindom/features/cloth/index.shtml">Clothes</a>: Krow’s Skindom article about creating 
					believable fabric and clothes. </font></li>

					modeling, animating, and skinning tools. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.planetquake.com/polycount/cottages/qbranch/links.shtml">Harlequin's Links page</a>
	</font></li>

					download link only.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.qeradiant.com/manual/Q3AShader_Manual/index.htm">Q3A Shader Manual on-line at qeradiant.com</a>
	</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.photovault.com/">Photo 
					Vault</a>: This is a stock photo service. The images aren't 
					for reuse, but they are a good source of ideas for models 
					and textures. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://gfxzone.planet-d.net/">gfxzone</a>: Site with a focus on per-pixel demoscene 
					graphics. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.sijun.com/dhabih/mainscreen.html">dhabih</a>: Artist's site with focus on traditional art 
					style computer graphics.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.saphiria.net/h/articles.shtml">Kirin's articles page</a>: Some tips on skin making and 
					texturing. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://user.aol.com/hangitover/pics/gordon.zip">gordon.zip</a>: An animated Milkshape mesh</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://dynamic.gamespy.com/~polycount/ubb/Forum2/HTML/000078.html">Example of QC compiling code</a>: This is a sample script 
					from NoseRider used by Milkshape 3D to format Quake 3 
					Models. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.cschell.com/tutoriallist.html">CasManG's Tutorial links page</a>: Contains links to many 
					tutorials for modeling, skinning and animating, some already 
					linked here. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="ftp://ftp.idsoftware.com/idstuff/quake3/misc/html_q3ta_teams.zip">HTML Format version of Team Arena Team Creation Document</a>: 
					Documents to be used as the Bible for creating new TA teams.
					</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="ftp://ftp.idsoftware.com/idstuff/quake3/misc/rtf_q3ta_teams.zip">RTF Format version of Team Arena Team Creation Document</a>: 
					Documents to be used as the Bible for creating new TA teams.
					</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.gmaxsupport.com">www.gmaxsupport.com</a>: Support for gmax tool. Of special 
					note is the Discussion forum that can be linked to from the 
					support page. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.3dluvr.com/content/">3DLuVr</a>: A general modeling website.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://cube.phlatt.net/home/spiraloid/">Spiraloid</a>: Bay Raitt's homepage. Tutorials and other 
					good stuff.</font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://1kai.dokkyomed.ac.jp/mammal/en/mammal.html">Mammal Skulls</a>: everything you always wanted to know 
					about skulls but were afraid to ask. </font></li>
	<li><font face="Tahoma" style="font-size: 9pt">
	<a target="_blank" href="http://www.fineart.sk/">Online 
					Anatomy Books</a>: These are scanned in art books. Lots of 
					resources, subscription required to take full benefit of 
					site.<br>&nbsp;</font></li>
</ul>
